intro: Sidalcea oregana var. spicata, commonly known as the spiculate checkerbloom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a taproot system and produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and ecological restoration projects.
